alert.note: Alert for Broome; Tioga; Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Broome, northeastern Tioga and southeastern Tompkins Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Caroline, or 11 miles southeast of Ithaca, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Caroline, Berkshire, Richford, Whitney Point, Lisle, Brooktondale, Slaterville Springs, Willseyville, South Danby and Center Lisle. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 near 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
